description:
The events ping's purpose is to transport all of the event metric
information. The `events` ping is automatically sent when the application
becomes inactive.

reasons.inactive:
The ping was submitted when becoming inactive. In earlier versions, this
was called `background`.
reasons.max_capacity: The maximum number of events was reached (default 500 events).
reasons.startup:
The ping was submitted at startup. The events ping is always sent if there
are any pending events at startup, because event timestamps can not be
mixed across runs of the application.

name: events

metrics.name: engine_tab.foreground_metrics
metrics.description:
Event collecting data about the state of tabs when the app comes back to
the foreground.

background_active_tabs.description:
Number of active tabs (with an engine session assigned) when the app
went to the background.

background_crashed_tabs.description: Number of tabs marked as crashed when the app went to the background.

background_total_tabs.description: Number of total tabs when the app went to the background.

foreground_active_tabs.description:
Number of active tabs (with an engine session assigned) when the
app came back to the foreground.

foreground_crashed_tabs.description:
Number of tabs marked as crashed when the app came back to the
foreground.

foreground_total_tabs.description: Number of total tabs when the app came back to the foreground.

time_in_background.description: Time (in milliseconds) the app was in the background.

metrics.name: error_page.visited_error

metrics.name: events.app_opened
metrics.description: A user opened the app (from cold start, to the homescreen or browser)

source.description:
The method used to open Fenix. Possible values are: `app_icon`,
`custom_tab` or `link`

metrics.name: events.app_opened_all_startup
metrics.description:
**This probe has a known flaw:** for COLD start up, it doesn't take into account if the process is already running when the app starts, possibly inflating results (e.g. a Service started the process 20min ago and only now is HomeActivity launching). See the `cold_*_app_to_first_frame` probes for a replacement.

A user opened the app to the HomeActivity. The HomeActivity encompasses the home screen, browser screen, settings screen, collections and other screens in the nav_graph. This differs from the app_opened probe because it measures all startups, not just cold startup. Note: There is a short gap between the time application goes into background and the time android reports the application going into the background. Note: This metric does not record souce when app opened from task switcher: open application -> press home button -> open recent tasks -> choose fenix. In this case will report [source = unknown, type = hot, has_saved_instance_state = false].

first_frame_pre_draw_nanos.description:
the number of nanoseconds the application took to launch. This is the
time difference between application launch(user pressing app_icon,
launching a link) and until the first view is about to be drawn
on the screen. If the time is not captured, this extra key will
not be reported.

has_saved_instance_state.description:
boolean value whether or not startup type has a savedInstance.
using savedInstance, HomeActivity's previous state can be restored.
This is an optional key since it is not applicable to all the cases.
for example, when we are doing a hot start up, we cant have a
savedInstanceState therefore we report only [APP_ICON, HOT] instead
of [APP_ICON, HOT, false].

source.description:
The method used to open Fenix. Possible values are `app_icon`,
`custom_tab`, `link` or `unknown`. unknown is for startup sources
where we can't pinpoint the cause. One UNKNOWN case is the app
switcher where we don't know what variables to check to ensure this
startup wasn't caused by something else.

type.description:
the startup type for opening fenix. the application and HomeActivity
either needs to be created or started again. possible values are
`cold`, `warm`, `hot` or `error`. Error is for impossible cases.
Please file a bug if you see the error case.
app created AND HomeActivity created = cold
app started AND HomeActivity created = warm
app started AND HomeActivity started = hot
app created AND HomeActivity started = error
Some applications such as gmail launches the default browser in the
background. So when we eventually click a link, browser is already
started in the background. This means that custom_tab will mostly
report `warm` startup type.

metrics.name: events.app_received_intent
metrics.description:
The system received an Intent for the HomeActivity. An intent
is received an external entity wants to the app to display
content. Intents can be received when the app is closed – at
which point the app will be opened – or when the app is
already opened – at which point the already open app will make
changes such as loading a url. This can be used loosely as a
heuristic for when the user requested to open the app. The
HomeActivity encompasses the home screen and browser screen but
may include other screens. This differs from the app_opened
probe because it measures all startups, not just cold startup.

source.description:
The method used to open Fenix. Possible values are `app_icon`,
`custom_tab`, `link` or `unknown`

item.description:
A string containing the name of the item the user tapped. These items
include:

  Settings, Help, Desktop Site toggle on/off, Find in Page,
  New Tab, Private Tab, Share, Report Site Issue, Back/Forward button,
  Reload Button, Quit, Reader Mode On, Reader Mode Off, Open In app,
  Add To Top Sites, Add-ons Manager, Bookmarks, History

An event that indicates that a user has selected

autocomplete.description:
A boolean that tells us whether the URL was autofilled by an
Autocomplete suggestion

metrics.description: A user opened a link with Fenix

mode.description:
The mode the link was opened in. Either 'PRIVATE' or 'NORMAL'. N.B.:
this probe may be incorrectly implemented: see
https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/14133

metrics.name: events.performed_search
metrics.description: A user performed a search

source.description:
A string that tells us how the user performed the search. Possible
values are:

* default.action
* default.suggestion
* shortcut.action
* shortcut.suggestion

metrics.name: events.preference_toggled
metrics.description: A user toggled a boolean preference in settings

enabled.description: Whether or not the preference is *now* enabled

preference_key.description:
The preference key for the boolean (true/false) preference the user
toggled.

We currently track: show_search_suggestions, remote_debugging,
telemetry, tracking_protection, search_bookmarks,
search_browsing_history, show_clipboard_suggestions,
show_search_shortcuts, open_links_in_a_private_tab (bug in
implementation https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/7384),
pref_key_sync_logins, pref_key_sync_bookmarks, pref_key_sync_history,
pref_key_show_voice_search,
and pref_key_show_search_suggestions_in_private.

metrics.description: A user closed the search shortcut menu in the search view by pressing the shortcuts button

metrics.name: search_shortcuts.opened
metrics.description: A user opened the search shortcut menu in the search view by pressing the shortcuts button

metrics.name: search_shortcuts.selected
metrics.description: A user selected a search shortcut engine to use

engine.description: The name of the built-in search engine the user selected as a string

metrics.name: search_suggestions.enable_in_private
metrics.description: A user enabled receiving search suggestions in private sessions

metrics.name: search_widget.new_tab_button
metrics.description:
A user pressed anywhere from the Firefox logo until the start of the
microphone icon, opening a new tab search screen.

metrics.name: search_widget.voice_button
metrics.description: A user pressed the microphone icon, opening a new voice search screen.

metrics.name: search_widget_cfr.add_widget_pressed
metrics.description: The user pressed the "add widget" button.

metrics.name: search_widget_cfr.canceled
metrics.description:
The user dismissed the search widget cfr by
tapping outside of the prompt

metrics.name: search_widget_cfr.displayed
metrics.description: The search widget cfr was displayed.

metrics.name: search_widget_cfr.not_now_pressed
metrics.description: The user pressed the "not now" button.

metrics.name: set_default_newtab_experiment.close_experiment_card_clicked
metrics.description: Close experiment card was clicked from new tab screen.

metrics.name: set_default_newtab_experiment.set_default_browser_clicked
metrics.description: Set default browser was clicked from new tab screen.

metrics.name: set_default_setting_experiment.set_default_browser_clicked
metrics.description: Set default browser was clicked from settings screen.

metrics.name: sync_account.closed
metrics.description: A user closed the sync account page

metrics.name: sync_account.opened
metrics.description: A user opened the sync account page

metrics.name: sync_account.send_tab
metrics.description: A user sent the current tab to another FxA device

metrics.name: sync_account.sign_in_to_send_tab
metrics.description: A user pressed the "sign in to send tab" button inside the share tab menu

metrics.name: sync_account.sign_out
metrics.description: A user pressed the sign out button on the sync account page

metrics.name: sync_account.sync_now
metrics.description: A user pressed the sync now button on the sync account page

metrics.name: sync_auth.auto_login
metrics.description:
User signed into FxA via an account shared from another locally installed
Mozilla application (e.g. Fennec)

metrics.name: sync_auth.closed
metrics.description: A user closed the sync page

metrics.name: sync_auth.create_account
metrics.description: A user pressed the create account button on the sync authentication page

metrics.name: sync_auth.opened
metrics.description: A user opened the sync authentication page

metrics.name: sync_auth.other_external
metrics.description:
User authenticated via FxA using an unknown mechanism. "Known" mechanisms
are currently sign-in, sign-up and pairing

metrics.name: sync_auth.paired
metrics.description:
User signed into FxA by pairing with a different Firefox browser, using a
QR code

metrics.name: sync_auth.recovered
metrics.description:
Account manager automatically recovered FxA authentication state without
direct user involvement

metrics.name: sync_auth.scan_pairing
metrics.description: A user pressed the scan pairing button on the sync authentication page

metrics.name: sync_auth.sign_in
metrics.description:
A user pressed the sign in button on the sync authentication page and was
successfully signed in to FxA

metrics.name: sync_auth.sign_out
metrics.description:
A user pressed the sign out button on the sync account page and was
successfully signed out of FxA

metrics.name: sync_auth.sign_up
metrics.description: User registered a new Firefox Account, and was signed into it

metrics.name: sync_auth.use_email
metrics.description:
A user chose to use their email to sign in instead of scanning a QR code,
counterpart to "scan_pairing"

metrics.name: sync_auth.use_email_problem
metrics.description: A user chose to use their email to sign in after an account problem

metrics.name: synced_tabs.synced_tabs_suggestion_clicked
metrics.description: The synced tab suggestion in awesomebar was clicked.

metrics.name: tab.media_pause
metrics.description: A user pressed the pause icon on a tab from the home screen

metrics.name: tab.media_play
metrics.description: A user pressed the play icon on a tab from the home screen

metrics.name: tabs.setting_opened
metrics.description: The tab settings were opened.

metrics.name: tabs_tray.cfr.dismiss
metrics.description: A user dismisses the tabs tray CFR.

metrics.name: tabs_tray.cfr.go_to_settings
metrics.description: A user selects the CFR option to navigate to settings.

metrics.name: tabs_tray.close_all_tabs
metrics.description:
A user tapped the close all tabs button in the
three dot menu within the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.closed
metrics.description: A user closed the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.closed_existing_tab
metrics.description: A user closed an existing tab

metrics.name: tabs_tray.menu_opened
metrics.description: A user opened three three dot menu in the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.new_private_tab_tapped
metrics.description: A user opened a new private tab

metrics.name: tabs_tray.new_tab_tapped
metrics.description: A user opened a new tab

metrics.name: tabs_tray.normal_mode_tapped
metrics.description: A user switched to normal mode

metrics.name: tabs_tray.opened
metrics.description: A user opened the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.opened_existing_tab
metrics.description: A user opened an existing tab

metrics.name: tabs_tray.private_mode_tapped
metrics.description: A user switched to private mode

metrics.name: tabs_tray.save_to_collection
metrics.description: A user tapped the save to collection button in the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.share_all_tabs
metrics.description:
A user tapped the share all tabs button in the
three dot menu within the tabs tray

metrics.name: tabs_tray.synced_mode_tapped
metrics.description: A user switched to synced mode

metrics.name: tip.closed
metrics.description: The tip was closed

identifier.description: The identifier of the tip closed

metrics.name: tip.displayed
metrics.description: The tip was displayed

identifier.description: The identifier of the tip displayed

metrics.name: tip.pressed
metrics.description: The tip's button was pressed

identifier.description: The identifier of the tip the action was taken on

metrics.name: toolbar_settings.changed_position
metrics.description: The user selected a new position for the toolbar

position.description: A string that indicates the new position of the toolbar TOP or BOTTOM

metrics.name: top_sites.long_press
metrics.description: A user long pressed on a top site

type.description: The type of top site. Options are: "FRECENCY," "DEFAULT," or "PINNED."

metrics.name: top_sites.open_default
metrics.description: A user opened a default top site

metrics.name: top_sites.open_frecency
metrics.description: A user opened a frecency top site

metrics.name: top_sites.open_google_search_attribution
metrics.description: A user opened the google top site

metrics.name: top_sites.open_in_new_tab
metrics.description: A user opens a new tab based on a top site item

metrics.name: top_sites.open_in_private_tab
metrics.description: A user opens a new private tab based on a top site item

metrics.name: top_sites.open_pinned
metrics.description: A user opened a pinned top site

metrics.name: top_sites.remove
metrics.description: A user removes a top site item

metrics.name: top_sites.swipe_carousel
metrics.description: A user swiped to change the page of the top sites carousel

page.description: The page number the carousel is now on

metrics.name: tracking_protection.etp_setting_changed
metrics.description:
A user changed their tracking protection level setting to either strict,
standard, or custom.

etp_setting.description: The new setting for ETP: strict, standard, custom

metrics.name: tracking_protection.etp_settings
metrics.description: A user opened tracking protection settings through settings.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.etp_shield
metrics.description: A user pressed the tracking protection shield icon in toolbar.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.etp_tracker_list
metrics.description:
A user pressed into a list of categorized trackers in tracking protection
panel.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.exception_added
metrics.description:
A user added a tracking protection exception through the TP toggle in the
panel.

metrics.name: tracking_protection.panel_settings
metrics.description: A user opened tracking protection settings from the panel.

metrics.name: user_specified_search_engines.custom_engine_added
metrics.description: A user added a new custom search engine

metrics.name: user_specified_search_engines.custom_engine_deleted
metrics.description: A user deleted a custom search engine

metrics.name: user_specified_search_engines.search_with_custom_engine
metrics.description: A user performed a search with a custom search engine

metrics.name: voice_search.tapped
metrics.description: A user selected the voice search button on the search screen.

metrics.name: app_build
metrics.description:
The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A").
For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value,
(e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier
can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other
language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration,
this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: app_channel
metrics.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

metrics.name: app_display_version
metrics.description:
The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").

In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved,
it is set to "inaccessible".

metrics.name: architecture
metrics.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

metrics.name: client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

metrics.name: device_manufacturer
metrics.description:
The manufacturer of the device the application is running on.
Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: device_model
metrics.description:
The model of the device the application is running on.
On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name,
like "Pixel 2 XL".
Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: first_run_date
metrics.description: The date of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_label
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_overflow
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_state
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_value
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: os
metrics.description:
The name of the operating system.
Possible values:
Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows,
FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

metrics.name: os_version
metrics.description:
The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the
version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: nimbus_events.disqualification
metrics.description: Recorded when a user becomes ineligible to continue receiving the treatment for an enrolled experiment, for reasons such as the user opting out of the experiment or no longer matching targeting for the experiment.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.enrollment
metrics.description: Recorded when a user has met the conditions and is first bucketed into an experiment (i.e. targeting matched and they were randomized into a bucket and branch of the experiment). Expected a maximum of once per experiment per user.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.exposure
metrics.description: Recorded when a user actually observes an experimental treatment, or would have observed an experimental treatment if they had been in a branch that would have shown one.

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: nimbus_events.unenrollment
metrics.description: Recorded when either telemetry is disabled, or the experiment has run for its designed duration (i.e. it is no longer present in the Nimbus Remote Settings collection)

branch.description: The branch slug/identifier that was randomly chosen

enrollment_id.description: A unique identifier generated at enrollment time

experiment.description: The slug/unique identifier of the experiment

metrics.name: android_sdk_version
metrics.description:
The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this
hardware device.
